resources.string: Visitors of certain locations must be vaccinated or must have taken a coronavirus test. Does the person at the entrance show a certificate of vaccination or a negative test result (no coronavirus)? Then they can enter.
Visitors first make a QR code of their vaccination or test result. Then you use this app to check the QR codes and see who is allowed to enter.

Green screen? Ask the visitor to show proof of identity. Check whether the data on your screen matches the data on the proof of identity. This goes for visitors from The Netherlands and visitors from other countries.
With this app, you can receive visitors again. But only if your location or activity falls under the designated locations.
The acceptable use policy details how CoronaCheck Scanner uses your data and what your rights are.
Location data are not saved or used
You\'re only allowed to use this data to check the valid certificate

The visitor\'s data is
not centrally stored anywhere
I\'ve read and agree to the acceptable use policy.
Sorry, there was a technical error
This is an international QR code
This is not a valid certificate in the Netherlands. Ask the visitor to show a Dutch QR code.
The visitor doesn\'t have a valid certificate. Read possible causes

This does not mean the visitor has coronavirus. Possible causes
  • The visitor shows an international QR code
  • The QR code has been forwarded
  • The QR code has been forged
  • The time on the visitor\'s phone is incorrect
What to do now?Ask the visitor to get vaccinated or to take a test. After that, the visitor can use the CoronaCheck app to turn it into a QR code.

Make sure the QR code belongs to the visitor by checking if the details on your screen correspond with their proof of identity.Note: details may be incomplete
In order to protect the visitor’s privacy, not all data is displayed. Some fields may contain a hyphen (-). It’s sufficient to check the details that are displayed.If the details are incorrect, the visitor is not allowed access.

CoronaCheck Scanner is created so that certain locations and activities can open their doors again. Think for example of football matches and concerts. With this app, visitors are able to prove they\'re vaccinated or they’ve recently tested negative for corona. This way, the Netherlands can head out more often.
"Point your device at the QR code on the visitor's screen. Or point it at the paper version of their certificate."
Scanner wants to access your camera
So the app can scan QR codes
The app is no longer in use. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl
To continue, install the latest version of the app.
You\'re not connected to the internet
You need to be connected to start the app.

Here\'s what changed
  • Description of acceptable use policy
  • App usage explanation
  • Camera usage permission
Read the full acceptable use policy here.
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You don\'t have access to the CoronaCheck Scanner app if you don\'t agree to the updated policy.

Press the \'Start Scanning\' button and ask the visitor to show their QR code. They can show their code using the CoronaCheck app or the paper version. The QR code acts as a certificate and can be read at a safe distance.
Point your phone camera at the visitor\'s certificate. Scan the QR code.
Person is holding a phone with a green screen and a black check mark.

Green screen? The visitor has a valid negative test certificate. Now check whether the data on your screen matches the data on the proof of identity. In order to protect the visitor’s privacy, not all data is displayed. Some fields may contain a hyphen (-). It’s sufficient to check the details that are displayed. <br\><br\>All good? Then the visitor may enter. They might also need an entrance ticket.
Person is holding a phone with a red screen and a black cross.

Red screen? This does not mean the visitor has coronavirus. It just means the QR code is invalid. So there is no proof of a recent negative test result. Here\'s what you can do:
  • Check whether the visitor shows the QR code using the CoronaCheck app. A screenshot or copy of the QR code always results in a red screen.
  • Check whether the visitor shows a Dutch QR code. An international QR code results in a red screen.
  • Ask the visitor to completely close the app and open it again. Then scan the QR code again.
  • Do you keep getting a red screen even though the visitor has a negative test result? Direct the visitor to our help desk. Phone number: 0800-1421.
A green screen is always needed for entry. Does the visitor not have a (valid) QR code? Then you cannot let them enter. Find more information here.
